quest.name: The Fire-bird Down Below
journal: Bunchin holds in his hand yet another missive addressed to you.

Genbu of the Four Lords, the legendary auspices who serve as guardians of the Ruby Sea, has once more summoned you to their hidden sanctuary beneath Hells' Lid. Though he did not divulge his reasons, it seems likely that it relates to the impending escape of the imprisoned Koryu.

As expected, Genbu seeks your assistance in quelling the aramitama of one of his comrades, the auspice Suzaku. However, when Genbu likens you to Tenzen, Suzaku flies into a rage, insulted by the suggestion that any mortal could ever compare to the fallen hero. Indeed, it appears there is more to this story than meets the eye...

Suzaku yet mourns for Tenzen, whom it seems she loved with all her heart, and despite the looming threat of Koryu's release, she is unable to move beyond her tortured past. Byakko attempts to make his ailing comrade see reason, but alas, the aramitama has driven her to the brink of madness, so much so that at times she seems to mistake you for her beloved. For a mercy, she consents to a battle that you might subdue her primal rage, but should you and yours falter, she will not hesitate to consign you to the fiery depths.

※Hells' Kier can be accessed via the Duty Finder.

The transformative powers of Suzaku were undeniably wondrous to behold, deadly as they were. Nevertheless, they were not enough to bewilder you and your comrades and deter you from your purpose. The auspice is once more the keeper of her soul.

In the wake of your battle, Suzaku reflects on the man she so dearly loved─how they met and traveled the land with her fellow auspices, earning the trust and adoration of so many, only to watch helplessly as their leader fell to their greatest foe. In the cruelest of ironies, Suzaku eventually came to wield powers with which she could have saved Tenzen, and for long years she wondered what purpose fate had in mind for her, but no longer. Once more will she join forces with Genbu and Byakko to carry on her beloved's legacy and defend the realm from the forces that would destroy it.

Genbu and the others are relieved to see that Suzaku is herself once more. Would that the same could be said for Soroban, who for the present has been transformed into a massive tortoise, perhaps by having summoned a great kami into his own body. Though the Kojin is understandably distressed, Genbu is unconcerned, and Tataru is simply annoyed to see history repeating, after a fashion. In any event, your work is done, and Soroban will probably recover. Probably.

To his credit, Bunchin takes the news of Soroban's predicament in stride. If anything, he seems to be somewhat puzzled by the whole affair, unsure whether or not it is some sort of elaborate Eorzean joke. Humor is subjective, to say the least...
objectives: Speak with Genbu in Reisen Temple.

dialogue.name: BUNCHIN
dialogue.text: How kind of you to pay us a visit, Forename. Now I need not summon you.

dialogue.name: BUNCHIN
dialogue.text: But a moment ago, a certain surly cat returned with another missive addressed to you. See for yourself...

dialogue.name: BUNCHIN
dialogue.text: (-Genbu's Missive-)Brave adventurer who stood fast and quelled the raging aramitama of my comrade, Byakko. The time has come for you to return to Reisen Temple.

dialogue.name: BUNCHIN
dialogue.text: I presume the auspices of Hells' Lid have need of you once more? If so, give my regards to them and dear Soroban.

dialogue.name: GENBU
dialogue.text: Well met, Forename, well met! But wait─where is the little urchin girl of whom I have grown so fond?

dialogue.name: GENBU
dialogue.text: It would be remiss of us to proceed without her, would it not? Why not summon her with that trinket of yours, your linkpearl?

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: (-Tataru-)Hello? Forename, is that you?

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: (-Tataru-)...Huh? Right now? Very well, if you insist...

dialogue.name: GENBU
dialogue.text: What wondrous things, these linkpearls. Now then─let us wait until your friend arrives...

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Forename, Genbu.

dialogue.name: GENBU
dialogue.text: Ah, good of you to join us, little urchin girl.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: ...You know, there is such a thing as running a joke into the ground.

dialogue.name: GENBU
dialogue.text: It pleases me to inform you that thanks to your assistance with his training, Soroban's strength has grown by leaps and bounds. Ere long we may count him among our most formidable warriors.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Out of curiosity, where is Soroban anyway?

dialogue.name: GENBU
dialogue.text: Engrossed in a very special exercise, I'm afraid. Trust me when I say he would not want you to see him in his current state.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Working up a sweat no doubt. Glad to hear it!

dialogue.name: GENBU
dialogue.text: But I called you here not to discuss our Kojin friend.

dialogue.name: GENBU
dialogue.text: The wards have grown weaker, presaging Koryu's inevitable escape.

dialogue.name: GENBU
dialogue.text: Before he breaks free, the Four Lords must marshal their strength.

dialogue.name: GENBU
dialogue.text: And so, Forename, I must entreat you to quell the raging aramitama of a dear comrade once more.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: A fight, is it? That's where our Warrior of Light shines! Who's herhis opponent this time?

dialogue.name: GENBU
dialogue.text: See for yourself. She should be joining us shortly...

dialogue.name: SUZAKU
dialogue.text: (-???-)It has been too long, elder brother.

dialogue.name: GENBU
dialogue.text: Several hundred years, by my reckoning. Am I to assume you have kept your silent vigil all this time, Suzaku?

dialogue.name: SUZAKU
dialogue.text: ...Let us not speak of such things. You bade me come hither for another purpose.

dialogue.name: GENBU
dialogue.text: That I did. Koryu's wards grow weaker by the day, and the calamity he would visit upon us draws nigh. The Four Lords must join their strength together once more.

dialogue.name: SUZAKU
dialogue.text: And to that end, this warrior would unburden my tortured soul.

dialogue.name: GENBU
dialogue.text: Just so. HersHis is a power far surpassing that of mortal men. SheHe is heir to the legacy of Tenzen.

dialogue.name: SUZAKU
dialogue.text: Brother! How dare you compare this creature to that shining paragon of virtue, of kindness! You sully his memory...

dialogue.name: SUZAKU
dialogue.text: And you! You dare think yourself his equal? His better!? Then I will put you to the proof. And when you fall, it will be a fate most deserved.

dialogue.name: SUZAKU
dialogue.text: Turn back if you would not have it be so. Or join me in misery.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Compared to Byakko, she seems much more...angry...

dialogue.name: GENBU
dialogue.text: The aramitama feeds upon her grief and fuels her rage. She yet mourns a love lost...but it is not my place to speak. Go to her, brave warrior, and learn the truth of her heart.

dialogue.name: BUNCHIN
dialogue.text: Do let me know how Soroban is doing. We cannot help but worry about him, even if we know he is in good hands.

dialogue.name: BYAKKO
dialogue.text: You are returned, then? Good. Genbu is looking for you.

dialogue.name: SUZAKU
dialogue.text: You crave battle, then. Even if it brings you your death.

dialogue.name: SUZAKU
dialogue.text: ...Out of duty you pit yourself against enemies ever stronger. Without hesitation, without fear, you muster your courage, and...and...

dialogue.name: SUZAKU
dialogue.text: No! You are not even a pale shadow of his glory! There was but one man fit to wear the mantle of hero, and he has long since passed from this world...

dialogue.name: BYAKKO
dialogue.text: If so, then the Ruby Sea will be consumed by Koryu's fiery judgment, and we, her sworn protectors, will have failed in our duty. Is Tenzen's memory so sacred that you would doom this land out of spite?

dialogue.name: SUZAKU
dialogue.text: Oh Byakko, do you not see? Before I called you brother, I was but a bird who loved a man. Perhaps that was all I was ever meant to be, for I can brook no replacement at my side or in my heart. Not so easily as you...

dialogue.name: BYAKKO
dialogue.text: Have you forgotten his final moments? How he fought and died to defeat Koryu─how he sacrificed himself before our very eyes?

dialogue.name: SUZAKU
dialogue.text: How dare you ask me that! Every detail is forever seared in my mind's eye─a blackened scar upon my soul! How could I possibly forget!?

dialogue.name: BYAKKO
dialogue.text: Nor should you! Nor will I forget every day we spent together on the road. But to exalt the past over the present, to live life in mourning and never move on is to dishonor his memory!

dialogue.name: SUZAKU
dialogue.text: How dare you speak to me of dishonor! You who have opened our home to this pretender! I see herhim plainly, how shehe has wormed herhis way into your hearts, mimicking Tenzen's manner, cloaking herselfhimself in his scent, seeking to supplant Tenzen in our minds!

dialogue.name: BYAKKO
dialogue.text: Listen to yourself, my sister. The aramitama has driven you to see oni in shadows. Let it be quelled, before your soul is forever lost.

dialogue.name: SUZAKU
dialogue.text: Only to Tenzen will I entrust my soul! Only his love will I accept!

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Let me help you.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: You have nothing to fear from me.

dialogue.name: SUZAKU
dialogue.text:
He said...he said... Oh, Tenzen...
Very well! But I will brook no delay!

dialogue.name: SUZAKU
dialogue.text: I will await you in the depths─in my place of mourning. And when it is ended, I shall mourn you too...

dialogue.name: BYAKKO
dialogue.text: Forgive her, Forename. She is yet consumed by her failure to save Tenzen all those years ago. Her regret is as a festering wound.

dialogue.name: BYAKKO
dialogue.text: The love she bore him gave her strength once. Alas, through it the aramitama has found purchase in her soul. It feeds on her grief and despair.

dialogue.name: BYAKKO
dialogue.text: 'Tis plain that your presence troubles her as well. She senses your blessing, and it reminds her of him. There were moments when she looked on you with a fire in her eyes...

dialogue.name: BYAKKO
dialogue.text: When she gives herself to the aramitama, she may surrender to her delusions as well. If so, do not be alarmed by what she says. Stand fast and free her from her torment.

dialogue.name: BYAKKO
dialogue.text: Be warned: she commands many powers, including the ability to manipulate geomantic currents. Only by remaining observant will you survive.

dialogue.name: GENBU
dialogue.text: Forgive her, my friend. She knows not what she says...

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Be careful, Forename. I don't think she's going to go quietly...

dialogue.name: BYAKKO
dialogue.text: Our dear sister, Suzaku, has returned. I pray she will hear reason this time.

dialogue.name: BYAKKO
dialogue.text: Remember: do not lose sight of your surroundings when you face Suzaku. If you would overcome the trials she sets before you, you must remain observant.

dialogue.name: SUZAKU
dialogue.text: ...How long have I been blinded by this dream? This never-ending nightmare, unable to escape the memory of my beloved...

dialogue.name: SUZAKU
dialogue.text: I owe you an apology, brave warrior, as well as my life. In spite of the crude and disrespectful way I treated you, you nevertheless risked your life to free my heart from the terrible delusion which threatened to consume my soul.

dialogue.name: SUZAKU
dialogue.text: For the first time in centuries, I can reflect on my time with the man I so deeply loved without being driven to tears...

dialogue.name: SUZAKU
dialogue.text: I was born into this world long, long ago, blessed with crimson plumage that shone like blazing fire in the sun.

dialogue.name: SUZAKU
dialogue.text: My form was likened to that of the Firebird of legend, a being said to have the power to confer immortality upon mortal men.

dialogue.name: SUZAKU
dialogue.text: Thus was I pursued endlessly by those who yearned to conquer death. To them─to all mankind, I was no more than a means to an end...

dialogue.name: SUZAKU
dialogue.text: But Tenzen...Tenzen, did not look upon me so. To him, I was so much more...and he would become everything to me...

dialogue.name: SUZAKU
dialogue.text: Together we traveled, we Four Lords and the samurai. As comrades-in-arms we journeyed the realm. Feared at first by many for our nature...

dialogue.name: SUZAKU
dialogue.text: But Tenzen, dear Tenzen, would not close his heart to the people's plight. Not once did he hesitate to proffer a helping hand, and one by one he won over those who once cursed and condemned us.

dialogue.name: SUZAKU
dialogue.text: Be there oni in the east to slay, or revenants in the west to exorcise, without hesitation would he bid us rise to the challenge, and leave grateful men and women to spread word of our deeds. Word which, one day, reached the ears of a king...

dialogue.name: SUZAKU
dialogue.text: 'Twas by the king's order that we battled the mad auspice Koryu. Despite the many deeds to our credit, we four had only lived some few centuries, and were no match for our foe.

dialogue.name: SUZAKU
dialogue.text: Against the might of Koryu's raging aramitama, my brothers and I were powerless. But Tenzen...brave Tenzen, he would not be denied. At the last he unleashed a powerful technique, knowing full well that it would leave him exposed...

dialogue.name: SUZAKU
dialogue.text: I watched as the light left his eyes forever...

dialogue.name: SUZAKU
dialogue.text: Had I been the Firebird of legend...had I been possessed of the power of immortality! Had I been able to rescue him from death's obsidian abyss...

dialogue.name: SUZAKU
dialogue.text: And then, the cruelest irony of all. Centuries later, when I finally went through the change, immortality became mine to command. I can but wonder if my bottomless grief for my beloved made it so.

dialogue.name: SUZAKU
dialogue.text: The power for which I yearned so desperately that day is now mine. If not to save him, then perhaps...

dialogue.name: SUZAKU
dialogue.text: ...Then perhaps to save those for whom Tenzen died.

dialogue.name: SUZAKU
dialogue.text: For the memory of my beloved, for his legacy, I shall fight. Let us go and tell Genbu together. And Forename...thank you.

dialogue.name: FURI
dialogue.text: Headed to the surface? Follow me!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Leave Reisen Temple?

dialogue.name: FURI
dialogue.text: Need a guide back to the temple? 'Course you do! Follow me!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Enter Reisen Temple?

dialogue.name: GENBU
dialogue.text: Oho, I see you are still in one piece. I gather all went well?

dialogue.name: SUZAKU
dialogue.text: Rest assured, elder brother, that I am myself once more.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: You certainly seem different from before! As if a great weight has been lifted from your shoulders. Your face is the very picture of serenity, I'd say!

dialogue.name: SUZAKU
dialogue.text: How very perceptive you are, little one. Indeed, I have at long last come to accept the passing of my beloved Tenzen...

dialogue.name: BYAKKO
dialogue.text: At long last indeed! But perhaps such prolonged periods of distress are unavoidable when one lives for more than a thousand years. I myself am no stranger to melancholy.

dialogue.name: SUZAKU
dialogue.text: ...No, my brother, that you most certainly are not.

dialogue.name: GENBU
dialogue.text: Oh, how forgetful of me! I have yet to see how Soroban's training is coming along.

dialogue.name: GENBU
dialogue.text: Soroban? Soroban!

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: W-Wait, I know this joke! Ahem!

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: It's a Firebird!

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: No, it's an airship!

dialogue.name: GENBU
dialogue.text: Ohoho! No, genre-savvy urchin, for it is, in fact...

dialogue.name: GENBU
dialogue.text: Soroban!

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: I mean...I expected him in some capacity, but not like this...

dialogue.name: SOROBAN
dialogue.text: No one told me that this training would lead to such a radical transformation! Look at me! I'm a giant tortoise! A tortoise!

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: ...I was wrong. This is the very definition of running a joke into the ground.

dialogue.name: GENBU
dialogue.text: There's no need for panic, Soroban. You probably just recited the words improperly and offered your body as a vessel for a great tortoise kami.

dialogue.name: SOROBAN
dialogue.text: That seems to me like a very, very good reason for panic! Unless...I will return to normal after a short while? Like with the tamate-bako of geomancy?

dialogue.name: GENBU
dialogue.text: Ah, well...I cannot say with any significant degree of certainty, but you might regain your original form by the time Forename quells Seiryu's aramitama.

dialogue.name: SOROBAN
dialogue.text: Might? Might!? What is this “might”? “Might” is not an acceptable answer!

dialogue.name: GENBU
dialogue.text: You must be exhausted from your battle with Suzaku, my friend. Perhaps it would be best if you returned to the land above and took a rest.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: He's right. I doubt we will be needed here for some time, and Soroban seems to be in no mood for company. Be sure to contact me if anything comes up!

dialogue.name: SOROBAN
dialogue.text: I had been meaning to return home, even if only briefly, but given my current state, that seems unlikely. If you could go in my stead and tell the elder I am...hale and healthy, I would be most grateful.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: How did your battle with Suzaku go? Is she still being...difficult?

dialogue.name: BYAKKO
dialogue.text: Is it true that in the West Lalafells are hunted for sport? 'Twas a strange tale related to me from a fellow auspice who overheard foreign adventurers in Yanxia...

dialogue.name: SUZAKU
dialogue.text: Long did I question why I had been granted this power over life and death too late to save my beloved.

dialogue.name: SUZAKU
dialogue.text: Now I understand: to carry on Tenzen's legacy, to save those for whom he gave his everything. Thank you for helping me to realize this, Forename.

dialogue.name: BUNCHIN
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename. All is well with our friends beneath Hells' Lid? What of Soroban? How goes his training?

dialogue.name: BUNCHIN
dialogue.text: He...failed to perform a ritual correctly and was transformed into a tortoise, you say? But you are aware that... Oh, I see. This must be some manner of Eorzean joke. How very amusing.

dialogue.name: BUNCHIN
dialogue.text: A pity we will not see him again for the foreseeable future, but I will trust it is for the best, as before. He should take as much time as required─he is a tortoise, after all! Hah hah...hah... Hmm. No, it still makes no sense to me...

dialogue.name: GENBU
dialogue.text: You needn't worry about Soroban. He will be fine. Eventually. Probably.

dialogue.name: SOROBAN
dialogue.text: Have I truly become host to a great kami? What if it does not wish to leave?

dialogue.name: SUZAKU
dialogue.text: Oh, my beloved, I pray you yet watch over me...

dialogue.name: BYAKKO
dialogue.text: It took me centuries to come to terms with Tenzen's passing. That Suzaku had not came as no surprise. Like us, Seiryu cared for him deeply, and I cannot help but worry that he too may struggle to accept your part in this...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have learned the emote Hum!
